enb_long_title: Thirteenth Session of the Subsidiary Bodies of the UNFCCC
sentences: Parties considered general provisions within the Co-Chairs' proposals on Thursday, 14 September.

With respect to the scope of application, Saudi Arabia, opposed by Samoa and Peru suggested that the compliance system apply to all commitments - not just those 'contained' in, but also those 'referred to' in the Protocol.
Samoa argued that this was not justified by the BAPA and added that the compliance procedure under the Protocol could not address obligations in the FCCC.
